ygData.subject: Re: The Stun idea and Bards in dungeons
ygData.msgSnippet: I haven t had first hand experience with Kelin s Lullaby since I m only leve 13, but I have seen it up close... About 5 levels ago (a month or two), I got a
ygData.messageBody:
I haven't had first hand experience with Kelin's Lullaby since I'm only leve
13, but I have seen it up close...

About 5 levels ago (a month or two), I got a bit too curious and fell down
the hole on the first floor of Befallen. Needless to say, the greater
skeleton, ghoul, and willowisp killed me rather quickly. After returning to
Befallen, a group which was comprised of people from a guild called The
Mystical Order (thanks a lot, by the way) helped me retrieve my corpse. On
the way back, their bard (around level 18) used the lullaby to sleep 4 ghouls
while the other party members killed them and led me to safety. Judging from
what I saw, I think that lullaby could work in dungeons.

Amhran, gypsy bard of the Soerbaird


In a message dated 5/29/99 11:45:03 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
tigger@... writes:

<< I do way better in outdoor zones, because in a dungeon not only can I not
run, but I am afraid to use my really cool area effect songs (The Level 15
Lullaby, The Level 20 Weakening Song, to name a few).

Has anyone used these kind of songs in a dungeon, and if so what was the
result? Killing your group? >>
